marketNews.title: Government Plans to Merge 7 BUMN Karya into 3 Entities
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Ministry of State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN), led by Minister Erick Thohir, announced that the government plans to reduce the number of BUMN Karya from seven companies to three through a consolidation, a move that is part of the financial health improvement of BUMN Karya that has been discussed since 2023. The surviving entities after the merger will be Adhi Karya (ADHI), PT PP (PTPP), and PT Hutama Karya. The merged entities will focus on their respective business lines: • PT Hutama Karya together with Waskita Karya (WSKT) will handle toll and non‑toll road projects, institutional buildings and residential‑commercial projects. • PT PP together with Wijaya Karya (WIKA) will handle airport, seaport projects and the remaining residential projects. • ADHI, PT Nindya Karya and PT Brantas Abipraya will handle water‑related construction and railway infrastructure. The ministry has coordinated with the Ministry of Public Works and Housing and the Ministry of Finance to push the consolidation, which is expected to be completed by October 2024 or before the minister’s term ends. The financial health of BUMN Karya has been under scrutiny, with WSKT reporting a debt‑to‑equity ratio (DER) of 9.88× (9M 2023), WIKA 4.52× (9M 2023), PTPP 1.55× (FY 2023) and ADHI 1.37× (FY 2023). In February 2024, WIKA and 15 creditors signed a master restructuring agreement (MRA) worth IDR 24.79 trillion. The consolidation is expected to strengthen capital structures, reduce competition and increase specialization, potentially improving profitability. However, the potential merger of PTPP and WIKA could generate short‑term negative sentiment for PTPP because PTPP’s financial health and profitability are currently stronger than WIKA’s. On Friday (22 Mar), PTPP fell 2.78 %, ADHI was unchanged, while WIKA and WSKT were under trading suspension.

tickerNews.title: INTP Posts FY23 Net Profit Up 6% YoY, In Line With Estimates
tickerNews.content: Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP) reported net profit of IDR 1.95 trillion for FY 2023, a 6 % year‑on‑year increase that met consensus. Revenue grew 10 % YoY, while cost of sales rose 8.2 % YoY, lifting gross profit by 14 % YoY. Quarterly, net profit for 4Q23 was IDR 683 billion (+20 % QoQ, –24 % YoY) on revenue of IDR 5 trillion (+1.3 % QoQ, +7.6 % YoY).

tickerNews.title: Bank Jago (ARTO) Reports FY23 Net Profit of IDR 72.4 bn, +355% YoY
tickerNews.content: Bank Jago (ARTO) posted net profit of IDR 72.4 billion for FY 2023, a 355 % YoY increase. The result was driven by a 17 % YoY rise in net interest income and a 152 % YoY increase in other operating income, lifting operating profit by 582 % YoY. In 4Q23, net profit was IDR 22 billion (+126 % QoQ) after a loss of IDR 25 billion in 4Q22, with NII of IDR 374 billion (‑0.7 % QoQ, +1.4 % YoY).

tickerNews.title: Astra International (ASII) Plans New EV‑Related Business Lines
tickerNews.content: Astra International (ASII) announced plans to add new business lines, including battery production for electric vehicles, electricity sales, and hazardous waste collection. The plan, to be discussed at the extraordinary general meeting on 30 April 2024, covers electric‑vehicle charging stations, battery‑swap stations, battery repair, battery collection and related services.

tickerNews.title: MPMX Targets 5% Revenue Growth in 2024 and Plans IDR 50‑75 bn Capex
tickerNews.content: Mitra Pinasthika Mustika (MPMX) said its target is a 5 % YoY revenue increase in 2024 and it will allocate IDR 50‑75 billion in capex for warehouse digitalisation and dealer renovation, a level below the analyst’s 100‑200 billion‑rupiah estimate, which could improve the dividend payout ratio.

tickerNews.title: ADHI Secures IDR 4 trillion New Contract in January 2024
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya (ADHI) recorded new contract value of IDR 4 trillion in January 2024, a 106 % YoY increase and 10.7 % of the 2023 target of IDR 37.4 trillion. The new contracts were 79 % water‑resource projects, 16 % building projects and the remainder in manufacturing, property, road and bridge works, with 90 % of the value coming from the government.

tickerNews.title: BDMN Approves FY2023 Dividend of IDR 1.23 trillion (35% Payout)
tickerNews.content: Bank Danamon Indonesia (BDMN) shareholders approved a dividend of IDR 1.23 trillion, or IDR 125.48 per share, representing a 35 % payout ratio. The ex‑dividend date and payment date have not been announced; based on the closing price of IDR 3 010, the implied dividend yield is about 4.2 %.

tickerNews.title: ISAT Plans IDR 12 trillion 2024 Capex for Rural Network Expansion
tickerNews.content: Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison (ISAT) said it will allocate IDR 12 trillion in capex for 2024 (vs. IDR 12.7 trillion in 2023) to expand coverage, increase capacity and improve network quality, especially in eastern Indonesia’s rural areas.

tickerNews.title: GGRP to Sell 76.07% of Subsidiary NBP for US$ 319.2 million
tickerNews.content: Gunung Raja Paksi (GGRP) intends to sell 76.07 % of its subsidiary PT Nusantara Baja Profil (NBP) for US$ 319.2 million (≈IDR 4.9 trillion). The buyers are Yamato Kogyo Co., Siam Yamato Steel Co. and PT Hanwa Indonesia, reducing GGRP’s stake in NBP to 5 %.

tickerNews.title: ESSA Declares IDR 86.13 million Dividend
tickerNews.content: Essa Industries Indonesia (ESSA) approved a dividend of IDR 86.13 million (IDR 5 per share). With the closing price of IDR 655, the implied dividend yield is about 0.8 %.

tickerNews.title: AGRO Announces Up to IDR 60 billion Share Buy‑Back
tickerNews.content: Bank Riau Kepri (AGRO) plans a share buy‑back of up to IDR 60 billion for its Management and Employee Share Ownership Programme; the execution date has not been set and the proposal will be discussed at the extraordinary general meeting on 30 April 2024.

tickerNews.title: GOOD Announces Up to 46.39 million Share Buy‑Back
tickerNews.content: Garudafood Putra Putri Jaya (GOOD) plans a share buy‑back of up to 46.39 million shares (0.13 % of the capital) with a maximum price of IDR 431 per share. The buy‑back is intended to support the share price if it does not reflect the company’s fundamentals.

tickerNews.title: AIMS Announces 770 Million Share Rights Issue and 77 Million Warrants
tickerNews.content: Akbar Indo Makmur Stimec (AIMS) plans a rights issue of up to 770 million new shares (250 % of paid‑in capital), which would dilute existing shareholders by up to 77.8 % and is accompanied by a 77 million‑share warrant at a 10:1 ratio. Seventy‑two percent of the proceeds will fund expansion in the entertainment‑and‑lifestyle sector, with the remainder earmarked for the acquisition of PT Super Potato Indonesia and a 159.2 m² office in Kebayoran Baru.

tickerNews.title: ADHI Declines to Comment on BUMN‑Karya Consolidation
tickerNews.content: Adhi Karya (ADHI) was noted as not commenting on the BUMN‑Karya consolidation plan, while PT PP (PTPP) said it is waiting for clearer guidance from the Ministry of State‑Owned Enterprises.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Awaits Clarification From Ministry of BUMN on Merger
tickerNews.content: PT PP (PTPP) said it is waiting for the clear direction from the Ministry of State‑Owned Enterprises regarding the proposed BUMN‑Karya merger.

tickerNews.title: WSKT Reports High Debt‑to‑Equity Ratio of 9.88× (9M 2023)
tickerNews.content: Waskita Karya (WSKT) reported a debt‑to‑equity ratio of 9.88× for the nine‑month period ending September 2023, indicating a high leverage level.

tickerNews.title: WIKA Reports DER 4.52× (9M 2023)
tickerNews.content: Wika (WIKA) reported a debt‑to‑equilibrium ratio (DER) of 4.52× for the nine‑month period ending September 2023.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Signs IDR 24.79 trillion Master Restructuring Agreement
tickerNews.content: PT PP (PTPP) disclosed a master restructuring agreement (MRA) worth IDR 24.79 trillion signed with 15 creditors in February 2024.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Shares Fall 2.78% on Friday
tickerNews.content: On Friday (‑ 5 March 2023 — the stock price of PT PP (PTPP) fell ‑2.78 % while ADHI remained unchanged and WIKA and WSKT were under suspension.
